text: When I notice myself speaking to defend, I recognize it and choose to shift toward connection instead.
During moments when communication feels defensive, I notice it and choose to pause and reconnect instead.
When I feel the pull to defend myself, I notice it and choose to speak to connect and understand instead.
I let speaking to defend prevent me from maintaining communication flow and connecting with my partner.
When I notice communication breaking down, I recognize it and choose to shift back to connection instead.
I see when my communication style is defensive, and I choose to adjust it toward connection instead.

I let not identifying my communication style prevent me from speaking to connect rather than to defend.
When I notice communication flowing well, I recognize it and choose to maintain that connection.

When I notice myself speaking to connect, I recognize it and choose to strengthen that pattern.
